questions.q: Which tendons lie volar to the distal radius?
questions.explanation: Flexor pollicis longus and flexor digitorum superficialis lie volar to the distal radius, making them relevant during volar plating.

questions.q: In carpal tunnel syndrome, which structure is most commonly compressed?
questions.explanation: The median nerve runs through the carpal tunnel and is the structure compressed in carpal tunnel syndrome.

questions.q: The floor of the carpal tunnel includes:
questions.explanation: The floor of the carpal tunnel is formed by the concave carpal bones like lunate and capitate.

questions.q: Which structure is at risk during volar plate fixation of distal radius fractures?
questions.explanation: Both the median nerve and FPL tendon lie close to the volar aspect and can be affected by hardware or retraction.

questions.q: Which of the following is NOT a content of the carpal tunnel?
questions.explanation: Flexor carpi ulnaris runs outside the carpal tunnel; the rest are within it.
